isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - CAB ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING - ELECTRIC WINDSHIELD WIPER AND WASHER, WITH INTERNATIONAL TURN SIGNAL SWITCH, WITH AND WITHOUT INTERMITTENT CONTROL

svcproc.title: ELECTRIC WINDSHIELD WIPER AND WASHER, WITH INTERNATIONAL TURN SIGNAL SWITCH, WITH AND WITHOUT INTERMITTENT CONTROL

table.title: Electric Windshield Wiper And Washer, With International Turn Signal Switch, With And Without Intermittent Control

entry.para: With ignition key off, check circuit breaker F18 for open condition.
Move key switch to ignition position and at F18 and circuit 12B measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12 or 12B, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (457), move key switch to ignition position, and at circuit 82K, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 82K, then repair.
At conn. (457), measure voltage from circuit 82K to 11-GK.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GK, then repair.
Remove low speed relay (272) and with key switch in ignition position, measure voltage from circuit 82L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 82 or 82L, then repair.
At conn. (457), install a jumper wire from circuit 82M to 11-GK. At relay socket (272), measure voltage from circuit 82L to 82M.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 82M, then repair.
Bench test low speed relay (272) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test low speed relay (272) by applying +12V to pin 86 and ground to 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Remove high speed relay (271) and move key switch to ignition position. At relay socket (271) and circuit 82A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 82 or 82A, then repair.
At relay socket (271) and circuit 82H, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 82H, then repair.
At conn. (457), move jumper wire to circuit 82J and 11-GK. At relay socket (271), measure voltage from circuit 82A to 82J.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 82J, then repair.
Bench test high speed relay (27) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test high speed relay (271) by applying +12V to pin 86 and ground to 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install high speed relay (271), disconnect conn. (29) and move key switch to ignition position. At (29) circuit 82C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 82C, then repair.
Remove jumper wire at conn. (457). At low speed relay socket (272) circuit 82F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 82F, then repair.
At conn. (457), install a jumper wire at relay socket (272) from circuit 82F to 82E. At conn. (29) and circuit 82E, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 82E, then repair.
Remove jumper at relay socket (272) and re-install low speed relay. At conn. (29), measure resistance from cir. 82D to 82E.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 82D, then repair.
At conn. (29) and circuit 82B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 82B, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (460) and with switch in off position, measure resistance from pin F to A, B and C of cable going to turn signal switch assembly.
(460), pin F to A, B, C.
At connector (460) going to switch, with switch in low position, measure resistance from pin F to A.
At conn. (460) going to switch, with switch in high position, measure resistance from pin F to A, B, and C.
(460), pin F to A, B, C.
At connector (460) going to switch, with switch in delay 1 position, measure resistance from pin F to B and C.
At conn. (460) going to switch, with switch in delay 2 position, measure resistance from pin F to A and C.
At conn. (460) going to switch, with switch in delay 3 position, measure resistance from pin F to C.
At conn. (460) going to switch, with switch in delay 4 position, measure resistance from pin F to A and B.
At conn. (460) going to switch, with switch in delay 5 position, measure resistance from pin F to B.
At conn. (460) going to switch, while holding washer lever in wash position, measure resistance from pin F to E.
For vehicles without delay wipers, disconnect conn. (460) and with switch in off position, measure resistance from pin F to A and B of cable going to turn signal switch assembly.
At conn. (460) going to switch, with switch in low position, measure resistance from pin F to B.
At conn. (460), going to switch, with switch in high position, measure resistance from pin F to A, and B.
At conn. (460) going to switch, while holding washer lever in wash position, measure resistance from pin F to E.
Reconnect conn. (460) and (457). Move key switch to ignition position, and move wiper switch to low position. At connector (29), measure voltage from cir. 82D to ground.
Move wiper switch to high speed position, and at conn. (29), measure voltage from circuit 82C to ground.
Reconnect wiper motor connector (29). Does wiper system operate properly?
Remove wash relay (270), move key switch to ignition position, and at circuit 87B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 87B, then repair.
At conn. (270) circuit 87E, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 87E, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (457) and install jumper wire from circuit 87F to 11-GK. At connector (270) circuit 87F, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 87F, then repair.
Remove jumper wire and reconnect conn. (457). Is washer bottle on left side of vehicle?
Disconnect conn. (2), and at relay socket (270) install jumper wire from circuit 87B to 87C. At (2), circuit 87C measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 87C, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (510) and reconnect conn. (2). At (510) circuit 87B measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 87B, then repair.
At conn. (510), measure voltage from circuit 87B to 11-GK.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GK, then repair.
On vehicles with washer bottle on right side of vehicle, disconnect conn. (510). At (270) install a jumper wire from circuit 87B to 87A. At (510) circuit 87A measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 87A, then repair.
At conn. (510), measure voltage from circuit 87A to 87-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 87-G or 11-GE, then repair.
Bench test wash relay (270) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test wash relay (270) by applying +12V to pin 86 and ground to 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
With jumper wire still in place at relay socket (270), reconnect conn. (510) and momentarily move key switch to ignition position. Does washer motor run?
Remove jumper wire and re-install washer relay (270). Move key switch to ignition position and move washer lever to wash position. Does washer function?
Wiper/washer circuits check good. If wipers fail to return to park position when wipers are shut off, replace defective park switch in wiper motor.
